de.thkoeln.cvogt.android.propanim_utilities

Class GraphicsUtilsCV

  • java.lang.Object
    • de.thkoeln.cvogt.android.propanim_utilities.GraphicsUtilsCV

  • public class GraphicsUtilsCV
extends java.lang.Object
    This class provides some utility methods for graphics programming. For utilities concerning mathematical graphs, see class GraphsUtilsCV.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static int ALIGN_LEFT
      Objects shall be left-aligned near the left border of the display.
      static int ALIGN_RIGHTLEFT
      Objects shall be left-aligned near the right border of the display (i.e. their left borders are aligned and the objects lie close to the right border, the object with the largest width lying closest).
      static int ALIGN_RIGHTRIGHT
      Objects shall be right-aligned near the right border of the display (i.e. their right bounds are aligned and lie close to the border).

      GraphicsUtilsCV()

      • distCentersHoriz

        public static int distCentersHoriz(AnimatedGuiObjectCV obj1,
                                   AnimatedGuiObjectCV obj2)
        Method to calculate the horizontal distance between two objects of class AnimatedGuiObjectCV. Let oleft be the left object and oright the right object, i.e. the X coordinate of the center of oleft is smaller than the X coordinate of the center of oright. Then the value returned is the difference between the X coordinate of the leftmost corner of the enclosing rectangle of oright (= its left bound in case of an unrotated object) and the X coordinate of the rightmost corner of the enclosing rectangle of oleft (= its right bound in case of an unrotated object).
        Parameters:
        obj1 - The first object
        obj2 - The first object
        Returns:
        Horizontal distance between the objects, as defined above

      • distCentersVert

        public static int distCentersVert(AnimatedGuiObjectCV obj1,
                                  AnimatedGuiObjectCV obj2)
        Method to calculate the vertical distance between two objects of class AnimatedGuiObjectCV. Let otop be the upper object and obottom the lower object, i.e. the Y coordinate of the center of otop is smaller than the Y coordinate of the center of obottom. Then the value returned is the difference between the Y coordinate of the upmost corner of the enclosing rectangle of obottom (= its top bound in case of an unrotated object) and the Y coordinate of the lowermost corner of the enclosing rectangle of otop (= its lower bound in case of an unrotated object).
        Parameters:
        obj1 - The first object
        obj2 - The first object
        Returns:
        Vertical distance between the objects, as defined above

        public static android.graphics.Point rotate(int toRotateX,
                                            int toRotateY,
                                            int centerX,
                                            int centerY,
                                            double angle)
        Method to rotate a point around a center.
        Parameters:
        toRotateX - Point to be rotated: x coordinate
        toRotateY - Point to be rotated: y coordinate
        centerX - Center of the rotation: x coordinate
        centerY - Center of the rotation: y coordinate
        angle - Rotation angle (in radians)
        Returns:
        The point after the rotation

      • pointsOnCircle

        public static android.graphics.Point[] pointsOnCircle(int centerX,
                                                      int centerY,
                                                      int radius,
                                                      int numberOfPoints)
        Method to calculate a number of points lying equidistantly on a circle around a center
        Parameters:
        centerX - Center of the circle - X coordinate
        centerY - Center of the circle - Y coordinate
        radius - Radius of the circle
        numberOfPoints - Number of points to be placed on the circle
        Returns:
        An array with 'numberOfPoints' Point objects specifying the coordinates of the points

      • pointsOnEllipse

        public static android.graphics.Point[] pointsOnEllipse(int centerX,
                                                       int centerY,
                                                       int radius,
                                                       double comprFactor,
                                                       double rotAngle,
                                                       int numberOfPoints)
        Method to calculate a number of points lying equidistantly on an ellipse around a center. The ellipse is implemented by a circle that is compressed vertically by a specified compression factor and then rotated by a specified angle around its center.
        Parameters:
        centerX - Center of the ellipse - X coordinate
        centerY - Center of the ellipse - Y coordinate
        radius - Radius of the ellipse
        comprFactor; - // Vertical compression of the circle (0<=comprFactor<=1), yielding the ellipse
        rotAngle; - // Rotation angle of the resulting ellipse (in radians)
        numberOfPoints - Number of points to be placed on the circle
        Returns:
        An array with 'numberOfPoints' Point objects specifying the coordinates of the points

      • getEnclosingRect

        public static android.graphics.Rect getEnclosingRect(java.util.Collection<AnimatedGuiObjectCV> guiObjects)
        Get the smallest rectangle that encloses a given set of objects of class AnimatedGuiObjectsCV.
        Parameters:
        guiObjects - The set of objects for which the enclosing rectangle shall be computed
        Returns:
        The minimal rectangle that encloses all objects (null if guiobjects==null or is empty)

      • getObjectsWithLineTo

        public static java.util.ArrayList<AnimatedGuiObjectCV> getObjectsWithLineTo(AnimatedGuiObjectCV guiobj)
        Method to find all objects that are connected to a given object of class AnimatedGuiObjectCV by lines of class DependentLineObjectToObjectCV.
        Parameters:
        guiobj - The object for which the connected objects shall be found
        Returns:
        An ArrayList with the connected objects

      • positionsVerticalAligned

        public static java.util.HashMap<AnimatedGuiObjectCV,android.graphics.Point> positionsVerticalAligned(java.util.Collection<AnimatedGuiObjectCV> guiObjects,
                                                                                                     int marginHoriz,
                                                                                                     int marginTop,
                                                                                                     int vertSpacing,
                                                                                                     int displayWidth,
                                                                                                     int alignmentType)
        Method to calculate the positions for a number of objects of class AnimatedGuiObjectsCV that shall be placed right- or left-aligned on the display, one below the other. Can be used to calculate the target points of an animation that shall move these objects.
        Parameters:
        guiObjects - The objects for which the positions shall be calculated
        marginHoriz - Horizontal margin = Distance to the left or right border of the display (depending on the alignment)
        marginTop - Top margin = Distance of the first object to the top border of the display.
        vertSpacing - Vertical spacing between the objects
        displayWidth - Width of the display (ignored if aligmentType==ALIGN_LEFT)
        alignmentType - How the objects shall be aligned - ALIGN_LEFT, ALIGN_RIGHTRIGHT, ALIGN_RIGHTLEFT
        Returns:
        HashMap with the positions - key set = the graphical objects, value set = the corresponding positions (x/y coordinates of their centers).

      • placeObjectsVerticalAligned

        public static void placeObjectsVerticalAligned(java.util.Collection<AnimatedGuiObjectCV> guiObjects,
                                               int marginHoriz,
                                               int marginTop,
                                               int vertSpacing,
                                               int displayWidth,
                                               int alignmentType)
        Method to place a number of objects of class AnimatedGuiObjectsCV on the display. The objects will be placed right- or left-aligned on the display, one below the other.
        Parameters:
        guiObjects - The objects to be placed
        marginHoriz - Horizontal margin = Distance to the left or right border of the display (depending on the alignment)
        marginTop - Top margin = Distance of the first object to the top border of the display.
        vertSpacing - Vertical spacing between the objects
        displayWidth - Width of the display (ignored if aligmentType==ALIGN_LEFT)
        alignmentType - How the objects shall be aligned - ALIGN_LEFT, ALIGN_RIGHTRIGHT, ALIGN_RIGHTLEFT

      • textToBitmap

        public static android.graphics.Bitmap textToBitmap(java.lang.String text,
                                                   int textSize,
                                                   int textColor,
                                                   int backgroundColor)
        Method to create a bitmap showing a string.
        Parameters:
        text - String to be shown
        textSize - Text size (in pixels)
        textColor - Color of the text
        backgroundColor - Color of the background
        Returns:
        A new Bitmap object showing the string.

      • makeBitmapTransparent

        public static android.graphics.Bitmap makeBitmapTransparent(android.graphics.Bitmap bitmap,
                                                            int colorToMakeTransparent)
        Method to make pixels of a given bitmap with a specific color transparent. Can e.g. be used to generate a bitmap with a transparent background.
        Parameters:
        bitmap - The bitmap for which pixels shall be made transparent
        colorToMakeTransparent - Color of the pixels to be made transparent
        Returns:
        A new Bitmap object, generated from the give bitmap with transparent pixels.

      • hasDescents

        public static boolean hasDescents(java.lang.String s)
        Method that checks if a string contains letters with descents. The string is assumed to contain ony letters and digits.
        Parameters:
        s - The string to check
        Returns:
        true if the string contains letters with descents, false otherwise

        Parameters:
        s - The string to check
        Returns:
        true if the string contains letters with ascents, false otherwise
